snippet: Forecasters projected possible heavy storms through Sunday and warned that other sections of the Eastern Seaboard could be subject to flooding through the day.

byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from North Charleston, and Alan Blinder from Virginia Beach. Vivian Yee contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: South Carolina officials scramble to rescue residents across state trapped by flooding from unprecedented rainfall caused by confluence of low-pressure system and Hurricane Joaquin; United States government declares federal disaster and National Guard is called in to help manage recovery.
lead_paragraph: Forecasters projected possible heavy storms through Sunday and warned that other sections of the Eastern Seaboard could be subject to flooding through the day.

headline.print_headline: Flooding Cripples South Carolina; Ship Still Missing
headline.main: Flooding Cripples South Carolina Where Some Areas See Over a Foot of Rain
